stateCorrectness.name: Fraud proofs are not enabled
stateCorrectness.description: OP Stack projects can use the OP fault proof system, already being deployed on some. This project though is not using fault proofs yet and is relying on the honesty of the permissioned Proposer and Challengers to ensure state correctness. The smart contract system permits invalid state roots.

risks.text: an invalid state root is submitted to the system.

references.text: L2OutputOracle.sol - Etherscan source code, deleteL2Outputs function

dataAvailability.name: All data required for proofs is published onchain
dataAvailability.description: All the data that is used to construct the system state is published onchain in the form of cheap calldata. This ensures that it will always be available when needed.

references.text: Derivation: Batch submission - OP Mainnet specs
OptimismPortal.sol - Etherscan source code, depositTransaction function

operator.name: There is no central operator
operator.description: There is no privileged entity that sequences transactions or produces blocks. This activity is permissionless and open to anyone.

forceTransactions.name: Users can force any transaction
forceTransactions.description: Because the state of the system is based on transactions submitted on the underlying host chain and anyone can submit their transactions there it allows the users to circumvent censorship by interacting with the smart contract on the host chain directly.

references.text: OptimismPortal.sol - Etherscan source code, depositTransaction function

exitMechanisms.name: Withdrawals are initiated on L1
exitMechanisms.description: Users can initiate a withdrawal from the L1StandardBridge escrow by sending a transaction to the L1 contract, forcing the operator to either process it, halt all withdrawals or produce an invalid state transition. Deposits from the L1StandardBridge are disabled, and the use of the fast bridge is encouraged. There is no way to force the fast bridge operator (EOA) to process a withdrawal.

references.text: PausedL1StandardBridge.sol - Etherscan source code, disabled _initiateBridgeERC20 function

risks.text: the fast bridge EOA operator signs an invalid withdrawal.

otherConsiderations.name: EVM compatible smart contracts are supported
otherConsiderations.description: OP stack chains are pursuing the EVM Equivalence model. No changes to smart contracts are required regardless of the language they are written in, i.e. anything deployed on L1 can be deployed on L2.

permissions.name: Guardian
permissions.description: Guardian is an actor allowed to pause deposits and withdrawals.

permissions.name: Challenger
permissions.description: Challenger is an actor allowed to challenge or delete state roots proposed by a Proposer.

permissions.name: Proposer
permissions.description: Proposer is an actor allowed to post new state roots of the current layer to the host chain.

permissions.name: FacetSafeModule
permissions.description:
* Can act on behalf of FacetMultisig.
* Can change the configuration of FacetEtherBridgeV6 (acting via FacetMultisig) - can withdraw all funds from the bridge.
* Can change the configuration of AddressManager (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig) - set and change address mappings.
* Can change the configuration of SystemConfig (acting via FacetMultisig) - it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.
* A Guardian  (acting via FacetMultisig).
* Can upgrade the implementation of OptimismPortal, SystemConfig, L2OutputOracle, SuperchainConfig (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig).
* Can upgrade the implementation of L1StandardBridge (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig) - upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.
* Module that allows the Safe to send Facet transactions.

permissions.name: FacetMultisig
permissions.description:
* A Gnosis Safe with 2 / 3 threshold. It uses the following modules: FacetSafeModule (Module that allows the Safe to send Facet transactions), EthscriptionsSafeModule (Module that allows the Safe to interact with Ethscriptions).
* Can act on behalf of ProxyAdmin.
* Can change the configuration of FacetEtherBridgeV6 - can withdraw all funds from the bridge.
* Can change the configuration of AddressManager (acting via ProxyAdmin) - set and change address mappings.
* Can change the configuration of SystemConfig - it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.
* A Guardian.
* Can upgrade the implementation of OptimismPortal, SystemConfig, L2OutputOracle, SuperchainConfig (acting via ProxyAdmin).
* Can upgrade the implementation of L1StandardBridge (acting via ProxyAdmin) - upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

permissions.name: EthscriptionsSafeModule
permissions.description:
* Can act on behalf of FacetMultisig.
* Can change the configuration of FacetEtherBridgeV6 (acting via FacetMultisig) - can withdraw all funds from the bridge.
* Can change the configuration of AddressManager (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig) - set and change address mappings.
* Can change the configuration of SystemConfig (acting via FacetMultisig) - it can update the preconfer address, the batch submitter (Sequencer) address and the gas configuration of the system.
* A Guardian  (acting via FacetMultisig).
* Can upgrade the implementation of OptimismPortal, SystemConfig, L2OutputOracle, SuperchainConfig (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig).
* Can upgrade the implementation of L1StandardBridge (acting via ProxyAdmin, FacetMultisig) - upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.
* Module that allows the Safe to interact with Ethscriptions.

permissions.name: EOA 2

addresses.name: FacetEtherBridgeV6
addresses.description: Official Facet implementation of the Ether Bridge.

addresses.name: AddressManager
addresses.description: Legacy contract used to manage a mapping of string names to addresses. Modern OP stack uses a different standard proxy system instead, but this contract is still necessary for backwards compatibility with several older contracts.

addresses.name: OptimismPortal
addresses.description: The main entry point to deposit funds from host chain to this chain. It also allows to prove and finalize withdrawals.

addresses.name: L1StandardBridge
addresses.description: The main entry point to deposit ERC20 tokens from host chain to this chain. This contract can store any token.

addresses.name: L1CrossDomainMessenger
addresses.description: Sends messages from host chain to this chain, and relays messages back onto host chain. In the event that a message sent from host chain to this chain is rejected for exceeding this chain's epoch gas limit, it can be resubmitted via this contract's replay function.

addresses.name: FacetSafeProxy
addresses.description: Helper of the Safe Module that allows to send Facet transactions.

addresses.name: L2OutputOracle
addresses.description: Contains a list of proposed state roots which Proposers assert to be a result of block execution. Currently only the PROPOSER address can submit new state roots.

addresses.name: ProxyAdmin
addresses.description:
* Can be used to configure AddressManager  - set and change address mappings.
* Can be used to upgrade implementation of OptimismPortal, SystemConfig, L2OutputOracle, SuperchainConfig.
* Can be used to upgrade implementation of L1StandardBridge  - upgrading the bridge implementation can give access to all funds escrowed therein.

addresses.name: SuperchainConfig
addresses.description: This is NOT the shared SuperchainConfig contract of the OP stack Superchain but rather a local fork. It manages the `PAUSED_SLOT`, a boolean value indicating whether the local chain is paused, and `GUARDIAN_SLOT`, the address of the guardian which can pause and unpause the system.

addresses.name: EthscriptionsSafeProxy
addresses.description: Helper of the Safe Module that allows to send Ethscriptions transactions.

risks.text: a contract receives a malicious code upgrade. There is no delay on code upgrades.

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No proofs
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: The proof system isn't fully functional
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a proper proof system fully rely on single entities to safely update the state. A malicious proposer can finalize an invalid state, which can cause loss of funds.

display.name: Facet
display.description: Facet is a based rollup built on the OP stack. It uses FCT as its native gas token, which is mintable by spending gas on L1.

warnings.stateUpdates: Please note, for Optimistic rollups the state is not finalized until the challenge period passes.

liveness.explanation: Facet is an Optimistic rollup that posts transaction data to the L1. For a transaction to be considered final, it has to be posted within a tx batch on L1 that links to a previous finalized batch. If the previous batch is missing, transaction finalization can be delayed up to 12h or until it gets published. The state root gets finalized 12s after it has been posted.

timeToInclusion.value: It's assumed that transaction data batches are submitted sequentially.

Main entry point for users depositing ERC20 token that do not require custom gateway.

layer.description: The data is posted to Ethereum as calldata.

bridge.description: The validating bridge has access to all the data, as it is posted onchain.

stateValidation.description: Currently the system permits invalid state roots. More details in project overview.

dataAvailability.description: All of the data needed for proof construction is published on Ethereum L1.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: Users can self sequence transactions by sending them on L1. There is no privileged operator.

proposerFailure.description: Only the whitelisted proposers can publish state roots on L1, so in the event of failure the withdrawals are frozen.
